messages.message: Just wanted to check in - I had a refiner which was displaying some weird behavior.  I refreshed the page, and am no longer able to load the refiner at all
hey @Dan H are you still experiencing this?
Hopped into a meeting.  Lemme refresh and try once more
if so, can you share the refiner with me
cool, do you mind describing a bit more the “weird” behavior you were experiencing before?
Sure!  For example, it seemed like refiner wasnt recognizing fields in the document.  I had a field which was calculated and filled in, however I was unable to reference that field successfully
hmm I see. Thanks! @Erick any idea if this could be caused by errors from the filesystem? I didn’t see any fileservice errors in the webservices around this time.
Could you send a link to the Refiner?

Alternatively, @Dan H could you clarify what you mean by “referencing that field”? Is it that you have something like
`field_1: scan_right(…)`
`field_2: echo(field_1)`

and field_2 fails with a message like “could not find `field_1`"?

This would be unlikely to be file-service issues. I would recommend making sure your fields are in an order where `field_2` (which references `field_1`) comes after `field_1`.

Hmm gotcha. Yeah I doubt that stems from the file-service issues. This sounds like it could be something in Refiner frontend, or you hadn’t run `field_1` yet potentially. Let me know if you run into it again :blush:

The easiest way to reproduce it would be to open the Refiner and _only_ “run field” on `field_2` without running `field_1` beforehand (but that is intended behavior — I can improve the error message if people are running into that). If you ever see this issue when clicking “Run All,” and the fields are definitely in a good order (`field_2` is after `field_1`), then we definitely have something to fix.
